attributes.action: Impose legislative changes to the Children Act 1989!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why, in this day and age, are some Laws allowed to be unequal and sexist?
The Children Act 1989 sect 2(2) states-
Where a child’s father and mother were not married to each other at the time of his(?) birth—
(a) the mother shall have parental responsibility for the child;
(b) the father shall not have parental responsibility for the child, unless he acquires it in accordance with the provisions of this Act.  
HOW DOES A CHILD BENEFIT FROM THE BLATANT UNEQUAL TREATMENT OF THEIR PARENTS?


I propose that this petition demands The Children Act 1989 needs to be reformed in a way which best promotes the CHILD'S WELFARE and treats the parents as equals. 
Such Legislation should be changed to say...
Parental responsibility shall be given to the parent whom is deemed/seen to be able to provide best for the child’s welfare etc, irregardless of that parent’s marital status and/or sex etc. 

And if the parents can’t decide whom can best provide for the child, then let our nation of excellent professionals make the decision for the children. 
Surely this method would deliver a better outcome for the child’s welfare, than a method which is currently based on INEQUALITY, SEX and LEGITIMACY?
